tit.cmt: ()内は4行め以降で説明される内容なので、省略してもよいです。

sen.j: 放鳥（ほうちょう）とは、人間によって捕獲あるいは飼育されていた鳥類を野外に放し、人間の管理下から離脱させること。
sen.e: Hocho is to let a bird, which has been captured or reared by human, secede from human stewardship by setting it free out of doors.
Hocho is to let a bird which has been captured or reared by humans free from human stewardship by releasing it out of doors.
Hocho is to let a bird which has been captured or reared by humans free from human stewardship by releasing it out of doors.

sen.j: 以下のような場合がある。
sen.e: There are the following cases.
Hocho occurs for various reasons.
Hocho occurs for various reasons.

sen.j: 繁殖のため人工的に孵化させて育てた鳥を放する。
sen.e: To release a bird which was incubated artificially and raised for breeding.
sen.cmt: 「放する」は「放す」として訳しました。
sen.e: To release a bird which was incubated artificially and raised for breeding.
To release a bird which was incubated artificially and raised for breeding.

sen.j: 日本では狩猟用の獲物として飼育していたキジやヤマドリを放すことが、日本各地の猟友会により続けられている。
sen.e: In Japan, Ryoyukai (hunting associations) across Japan continue releasing a pheasant and a copper pheasant which were reared as game for hunting.
In Japan, ryoyukai (hunting associations) across Japan continue to release pheasants and copper pheasants which were reared as game for hunting.
In Japan, ryoyukai (hunting associations) across Japan continue to release pheasants and copper pheasants which were reared as game for hunting.

sen.j: 野生で希少になった鳥を繁殖して放す。
sen.e: To release a bird after breeding which has become rare in nature.
To release endangered birds after breeding.
To release endangered birds after breeding.

sen.j: 日本のコウノトリは野生での絶滅状態を受け、人工飼育によって繁殖が行われている。
sen.e: The stork in Japan is bred by artificial rearing because it has gone extinct in nature.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The stork in Japan is bred through artificial rearing because it has become extinct in the wild.
The stork in Japan is bred through artificial rearing because it has become extinct in the wild.

sen.j: 2005年から放鳥による野生化が試みられている。
sen.e: It has been tried to make the stork settle in nature by hocho since 2005.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Hocho has been used in order to encourage storks to breed in the wild since 2005.
Hocho has been used in order to encourage storks to breed in the wild since 2005.

sen.j: 分布 (生物)・生態の調査のために一時的に野鳥を捕獲し目印を付けて再び放す。
sen.e: To release a wild bird again after temporary capturing and marking for investigation of distribution (living organism) and ecology.
sen.cmt: againは英文で意味を持ちませんが、原文の「再び」の逐語訳として入れてあります。
sen.e: To release a wild bird after its temporary capture and marking for investigation of its distribution and ecology.
sen.cmt: Grammar. The phrase '(living organism)' is not necessary I think.
sen.e: To release a wild bird after its temporary capture and marking for investigation of its distribution and ecology.

sen.j: 宗教的な放鳥。
sen.e: Religious hocho.
Hocho for religious reasons.
Hocho for religious reasons.

sen.j: かつては葬儀や放生会において、功徳を積むために予め捕らえておいた鳥を放してやることも行われていた。
sen.e: It used to be done to release a preliminarily captured bird at a funeral ceremony and Hojoe (the ritual for releasing living beings) to do good deeds.
Previously captured birds were released at funeral ceremonies and during hojoe (the ritual for releasing living beings) in order to do good or pious deeds.
Previously captured birds were released at funeral ceremonies and during hojoe (the ritual for releasing living beings) in order to do good or pious deeds.

sen.j: 式典の演出として。
sen.e: As stage effects in ceremony.
As stage effects in ceremonies.
As stage effects in ceremonies.

sen.j: 祭典を盛り上げるために、鳥を空に舞わせる。
sen.e: Birds are thrown up to wheel in the sky in order to pump up a festival.
Birds are sometimes thrown up to wheel in the sky in order to bring a festival to life.
Birds are sometimes thrown up to wheel in the sky in order to bring a festival to life.

sen.j: 往々にして平和の使いとして鳩の群れを放す。
sen.e: A flock of pigeons is often released as a messenger of peace.
A flock of pigeons is often released as a messenger of peace.
A flock of pigeons is often released as a messenger of peace.

sen.j: 個人の葬儀で行われた例もある。
sen.e: There is a case that it was done at a private funeral ceremony.
On occasion hocho is done at private funeral ceremonies.
On occasion hocho is done at private funeral ceremonies.

sen.j: 飼い鳥の場合、近年、コンパニオンバードと呼ばれる手乗り文鳥、オカメインコ、コザクラインコなど飼い主に馴れている飼い鳥をケージから出して、部屋の中で飼い主とひとときを楽しむ行為を指している。
sen.e: In case of domestic birds, in recent years, hocho means an act to uncage the bird, which is attached to the owner and called a companion bird including tame paddybird, cockatiel and peach-faced lovebird, for enjoying a time with the owner in a room.

In recent years hocho has come to mean the act of uncaging birds such as so-called companion birds including tame paddybirds, cockatiels and peach-faced lovebirds, and releasing them into a room while remaining attached to the owner, so that the owner can experience and enjoy time with the bird in a freer setting than the cage.

sen.j: ケージの中では飛ぶことができない小鳥にとってストレス解消､運動､飼い主とのコミュニケーションを深めるため有意義である｡
sen.e: It is fruitful for the bird which can not fly in a cage because it can relieve its stress, take exercise and promote communication with the owner.
It is beneficial for birds which can not fly in their cage because they can relieve stress, take exercise and increase communication with the owner.
It is beneficial for birds which can not fly in their cage because they can relieve stress, take exercise and increase communication with the owner.

sen.j: 安易な放鳥は危険である。
sen.e: Hocho without much thought is harmful.
Hocho without much consideration can be harmful.
Hocho without much consideration can be harmful.

sen.j: 他地方のものを放せば移入種を作り、生態系の霍乱や遺伝子汚染を引き起こす。
sen.e: If a bird of other region is released, it becomes an introduced species and causes a disturbance of an ecosystem and genetic contamination.
If a bird not found in the local area is released, it becomes an introduced species and may cause pressure on an ecosystem or genetic contamination.
If a bird not found in the local area is released, it becomes an introduced species and may cause pressure on an ecosystem or genetic contamination.

sen.j: 日本のコジュケイやコウライキジは狩猟のための放鳥によって定着したものである。
sen.e: Chinese bamboo partridge and Mongolian pheasant in Japan have settled through hocho for hunting.
The Chinese bamboo partridge and Mongolian pheasant have settled in Japan through hocho for hunting.
The Chinese bamboo partridge and Mongolian pheasant have settled in Japan through hocho for hunting.

sen.j: 都会のハトの起源も放鳥が一つと考えられる。
sen.e: Hocho is considered to be one of the origins of pigeons in cities.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Hocho is considered to be one of the origins of pigeons in cities.
Hocho is considered to be one of the origins of pigeons in cities.

sen.j: 近年はハトの害が問題となり、放鳥が慎まれるようになった。
sen.e: In recent years, hocho has been withheld because the harm of pigeons has become a problem.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In recent years, hocho has been reduced because the harm caused by pigeons has become a problem.
In recent years, hocho has been reduced because the harm caused by pigeons has become a problem.

sen.j: また、保護のための放鳥も困難な問題を抱える。
sen.e: Hocho for preservation is also faced with difficult problems.
Hocho for species preservation is also faced with difficult problems.
Hocho for species preservation is also faced with difficult problems.

sen.j: 人工飼育の鳥が野生で生活を維持することはさほど簡単ではないことがわかっている。
sen.e: It is found not very easy for an artificially reared bird to maintain its life in nature.
Practise suggests that it is not very easy for an artificially reared bird to maintain its life in the wild.
Practice suggests that it is not very easy for an artificially reared bird to maintain its life in the wild.
